skills_data.description: Compilation of Skills for Star Wars SAGA Edition.

skills_list.name: Acrobatics

common_uses.description: Move at half speed along a narrow surface. DC varies with surface width. If surface is slippery or unstable, increase DC by 5. You are considered flat-footed while balancing, unless trained in Acrobatics. If you take damage while balancing, make another Acrobatics check against the same DC to keep from falling. [CRB text p.63, cite: 404-405]

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.63 for full DC table.

common_uses.action_cost: Part of movement (move at half speed)

common_uses.description: Move through difficult terrain at your normal speed. [CRB text p.64, cite: 406]
Slip free of restraints, wriggle through a tight space, or escape from a grapple. [CRB text p.64, cite: 406-407]

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.64 for specific DC values.

common_uses.time_to_perform: Attack action to escape a grapple. Full-round action to escape a net or to move 1 square through a tight space. 1 minute to escape from ropes, binder cuffs, or manacles.

common_uses.description: Drop to a prone position as a free action instead of a swift action. [CRB text p.64, cite: 407]

You can reduce the damage you take from a fall with a successful DC 15 Acrobatics check. If your check result beats the DC by 10 or more, you take only one-quarter damage. If it beats the DC by 20 or more, you take no damage. Errata (CRB p.291 for CRB p.255): If the check succeeds and you take no damage from the fall, you land on your feet. If you fall from a height of greater than 60 meters, treat the fall as being only 60 meters for the purposes of reducing falling distance with this skill. If struck by a falling object, a successful check reduces damage by half. [Sourced from CRB p.64, Errata p.291]

common_uses.use_name: Stand Up from Prone (as Swift Action)
common_uses.description: Stand up from a prone position as a swift action instead of a move action. [CRB text p.64, cite: 409]

Tumble through the threatened area or fighting space of an enemy as part of your move action without provoking an attack of opportunity. Each threatened square or occupied square that you tumble through counts as 2 squares of movement. [CRB text p.64, cite: 409-410]

skills_list.description_general: You can move at normal speed across difficult terrain, keep your balance while walking on a narrow surface, take less damage from a fall, slip free of restraints or a grappling foe, and get up from prone safely. In addition to the specific options listed below, you can use Acrobatics to perform typical tumbling, flipping, or gymnastic maneuvers. [CRB text p.63, cite: 404]
special_rules_summary: You can't take 10 or take 20 on an Acrobatics check. [CRB text p.64, cite: 410]

If you are trained in Acrobatics, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense when fighting defensively (see Fighting Defensively, page 152). (CRB Errata p.290 changes this to +5 bonus [cite: 1968])

skills_list.name: Climb

common_uses.description: Advance up, down, or across a slope or a wall or other steep incline (or even a ceiling with handholds). A slope is <60 degrees; a wall is >=60 degrees. Climb at one-half speed as a full-round action, or one-fourth speed as a move action. Failure by 5+ means you fall. [CRB text p.65, cite: 411-412]

details.condition: Slope too steep to walk up; knotted rope with a wall to brace against.
Rope with a wall to brace against or a knotted rope, but not both.
Surface with adequate handholds/footholds (rough natural rock, tree); unknotted rope.
Overhang or ceiling with handholds but no footholds.

modifiers.condition: Climbing inside air duct (brace against two opposite walls)
Climbing a corner (brace against perpendicular walls)

dc.notes: Perfectly smooth, flat, vertical surface cannot be climbed. Opponents get +2 to attack you; you lose DEX to Reflex Defense. If you take damage, make a Climb check against wall's DC to avoid falling. Reference CRB p.65.

common_uses.description: Climb more quickly than normal, but take a -5 penalty on Climb checks. Allows climbing at full speed as a full-round action, or one-half speed as a move action. [CRB text p.65, cite: 416]
Attempt to catch yourself on a wall while falling. Make a Climb check (DC = wall's DC + 20). A slope is relatively easier (DC = slope's DC + 10). [CRB text p.65, cite: 416]
Make your own handholds/footholds by pounding pitons into a wall or cutting into an ice wall. Reduces Climb DC of that surface to 15. [CRB text p.65, cite: 416-417]

dc.notes: Requires appropriate tools (pitons, ice axe).

common_uses.time_to_perform: 1 minute per piton (one piton needed per meter).

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to scale a cliff, to get to a window on the second story of a building, or to climb up an antenna array after falling out of an airway at the bottom of a floating city. [CRB text p.64, cite: 410-411]
special_rules_summary: Someone using a rope can haul a character by strength (see encumbrance rules p.140).
You can take 10 while climbing, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.65, cite: 418]

skills_list.name: Deception

common_uses.description: Produce a deceptive appearance (disguise, forged documents). Make a Deception check opposed by Perception of any target. Success means target believes appearance is authentic. Modifiers apply based on difficulty. Rushing incurs -10 penalty. [CRB text p.65-66, cite: 420-421, 423-426]

modifiers_based_on_difficulty.description: Works in target's favor or matches expectations. Ex: convincing junk dealer to buy stolen droids; simple disguise.
Believable, doesn't affect target much. Ex: convincing suspicious guard you're not a thief; disguise as different species/gender.
Hard to believe, puts target at risk, or undergoes scrutiny. Ex: convincing thugs you can beat them; impersonating officer; false documents passing electronic screening.
Very hard to believe, sizable risk to target, intense scrutiny. Ex: convincing dealer to buy stolen Imperial shuttle; impersonating someone to an old friend.
Almost too unlikely, requires material you don't have. Ex: impersonating a Jedi to fool another Jedi; claiming to be Emperor giving orders.

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.66 for Difficulty Modifiers table.

common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies: At least 1 minute for simple, 10 minutes for moderate, 1 hour for difficult, 1 day for incredible, 2 weeks (10 days) for outrageous.

common_uses.description: Communicate deceptive information (lie, distort facts). Make Deception check against Will Defense of target. Success means target believes information. Modifiers apply based on difficulty. Rushing incurs -10 penalty. If combined with deceptive appearance, compare single check to both Perception and Will Defense, or make separate checks if different timings. [CRB text p.66, cite: 421-422, 428-431]

dc.notes: Failure by 10 or less may mean target believes but is reluctant if risky. Failure by 11+ means target sees through deception. Reference CRB p.66 for Difficulty Modifiers table.

common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies: At least Standard Action for simple, Full-round for moderate, 1 minute+ for difficult/incredible/outrageous.

common_uses.description: Use Deception to help you hide. Successful Deception check (vs. target's Will Defense) gives momentary diversion needed to attempt a Stealth check while target is aware. [CRB text p.67, cite: 432-433]
common_uses.action_cost: Varies (Deception part), then Stealth check as move action.

common_uses.description: Make a Deception check as a standard action opposed by target's Initiative check. If you beat opponent's roll, target is flat-footed against your first attack next round. -5 penalty vs. non-humanoids or creatures with INT < 3. [CRB text p.67, cite: 433]

skills_list.description_general: You can make the untrue seem true, the outrageous seem plausible, and the nefarious seem ordinary. The skill encompasses conning, fast-talking, misdirection, forgery, disguise, and outright lying. [CRB text p.65, cite: 419]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: Generally, a failed Deception check makes the target too suspicious for another attempt in the same circumstances. For feinting in combat, you may retry freely. [CRB text p.67, cite: 434]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a deception (except for feinting in combat), but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.67, cite: 434]

skills_list.name: Endurance

common_uses.description: Each hour of walking after 8 hours requires a DC 10 Endurance check (+2 DC per hour after the first). Failure means -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by 8 hours rest). [CRB text p.67, cite: 435]

Hold breath for rounds equal to CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each round (+2 DC per additional round). Failure: must breathe or -1 step on condition track. Unconscious at bottom of track; die next turn if still unable to breathe. [CRB text p.67, cite: 436]

Go without food for days equal to CON modifier (min 1). Then, DC 10 Endurance check each day (+2 DC per day thereafter). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by nutritious meal). [CRB text p.67, cite: 437]

Go without water for hours equal to 3x CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each hour (+2 DC per day thereafter according to text, likely error and means per hour). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by drinking ~1 liter water). [CRB text p.67, cite: 437-438]

dc.notes: CRB p.67 text states '+2 each day thereafter' for thirst DC increase, but context of hourly checks suggests per hour was intended.

common_uses.description: Run as full-round action up to 4x speed (3x in heavy armor/load). Lose DEX to Reflex. Run for rounds = CON score. Then, DC 10 Endurance check each round (+1 DC per previous check). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by resting for same duration as run; can only move speed during this rest). [CRB text p.67, cite: 439-441]
Sleep in armor with Endurance check (DC 10 light, DC 15 medium, DC 20 heavy). Failure: no sleep, -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by 8 hours sleep). [CRB text p.67, cite: 441]

Each hour swimming: DC 15 Endurance check (+2 DC per consecutive hour). Failure: -1 persistent step on condition track (removed by resting for same duration as swim). Treading water reduces DC by 5. [CRB text p.67, cite: 441-442]

skills_list.description_general: You can push yourself beyond your normal physical limits. [CRB text p.67, cite: 435]

skills_list.name: Gather Information

common_uses.description: Major news stories and popular local rumors can be unearthed with a DC 10 Gather Information check. Learning the detailed, unclassified facts of a news story or determining the veracity of a rumor requires a DC 20 check and 50 credits in bribes. [CRB text p.68, cite: 442-443]

'Secret information' includes anything unavailable to the general public. Examples include a classified police report, a hidden location, military blueprints, installation security procedures, and computer access codes. Learning a piece of secret information typically requires a DC 25 check and 5,000 credits in bribes; however, information that's especially difficult to obtain (such as the technical blueprints of the Death Star) might require a DC 30 or higher skill check and cost 50,000 credits or more, at the GM's discretion. If the check fails by 5 or more, someone notices that you're asking questions and comes to investigate, arrest, or silence you. [CRB text p.68, cite: 443-444]

Make a Gather Information check to locate a specific individual—either someone you know by name or someone with the skill, item, or information you need. The DC of the check is 15 if the target is relatively easy to locate; if the target isn't well known or has taken strides to conceal his or her presence and/or activities, the DC is 25 and the information costs 500 credits in bribes. [CRB text p.68-69, cite: 444-445]

options.condition: Target not well known or concealed

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to make contacts, learn local new stories and gossip, and acquire secrets. [CRB text p.68, cite: 442]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on a Gather Information check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.69, cite: 446]
A successful Persuasion check can reduce the monetary cost of a Gather Information check. [CRB text p.69, cite: 446]
Some information is beyond the reach of a Gather Information skill check (GM discretion). [CRB text p.69, cite: 446]

skills_list.name: Initiative

common_uses.description: An Initiative check sets the order of combat when a fight starts. Each character aware of the fight makes an Initiative check and goes in order from highest to lowest. When piloting a vehicle in combat, you must apply the vehicle's size modifier to your Initiative check. [CRB text p.69, cite: 447]

dc.notes: Sets turn order.

common_uses.description: When an opponent attempts to feint in combat, you oppose their Deception check with an Initiative check. If you meet or beat their check result, their feint attempt fails. [CRB text p.69, cite: 447-448]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to gain the advantage in combat. [CRB text p.69, cite: 447]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on an Initiative check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.69, cite: 448]

skills_list.name: Jump

common_uses.description: The DC of a running long jump is equal to the distance cleared (in meters) multiplied by 3. For example, clearing a 3-meter-wide (2-square-wide) pit requires a successful DC 9 Jump check. If you do not get at least a 4-square running start, the DC is doubled. [CRB text p.69, cite: 449]

The DC of a running high jump is equal to the distance cleared (in meters) multiplied by 12. For example, landing atop a 1.5-meter-high (1-square-high) ledge requires a successful DC 18 Jump check. If you use a pole of sufficient height to help you vault the distance, the DC is halved. If you do not get at least a 4-square running start, the DC is doubled. [CRB text p.69, cite: 449-450]

If you intentionally jump down from a height, you can attempt a DC 15 Jump check to take falling damage as if you had dropped 3 meters (2 squares) fewer than you actually did. For every 10 points by which you beat the DC, you can subtract an additional 3 meters from the fall when determining damage. Errata (CRB p.291 for CRB p.255): If the check succeeds and you take no damage from the fall (because the effective fall distance was reduced to 0 or less through successive reductions), you land on your feet. If you fall from a height of greater than 60 meters, treat the fall as being only 60 meters for the purposes of reducing falling distance with this skill. [Sourced from CRB p.69, Errata p.291]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to leap over pits, vault low fences, or jump down from a tree's lowest branches. [CRB text p.69, cite: 449]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Jump check. [CRB text p.69, cite: 450]
If there is no danger associated with failing, you can take 20. [CRB text p.69, cite: 450]
Distance covered by a long jump or high jump counts against your maximum movement in a round; distance covered by jumping down does not. [CRB text p.69, cite: 451]

skills_list.name: Mechanics

common_uses.description: Disarm a security device, defeat a lock, or disable/rig a mechanical trap. Requires appropriate tools (e.g., security kit for locks/electronic traps, tool kit for mechanical traps). Disabling a simple device takes 1 minute. Complex devices might take longer. The DC is set by the device or trap. If disabling a trap and the check fails by 10 or more, you trigger it. If attempting to rig a device to fail and the check fails by 5 or more, you believe it's rigged but it isn't. [Sourced from CRB p.70, p.253]

details.condition: Simple device (sabotage mechanical, jam blaster, bypass basic mechanical lock)
Tricky device (sabotage electronic, bypass basic electronic lock)
Complex device (disarm electronic security, bypass complex lock)

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.70

common_uses.description: Connect a detonator to an explosive. Failure means explosive fails to go off. Failure by 10+ means it goes off during installation. Can set a higher disarm DC (New Set Detonator DC = Chosen Disarm DC - 5). [CRB text p.70, cite: 457-458]

dc.notes: DC can be increased if setting a higher disarm DC.

common_uses.description: Carefully place explosive against fixed structure/vehicle for maximum effect. GM makes check. DC 15: ignore target's DR. DC 25: double damage. DC 35: triple damage. Normal damage to other targets in burst. [CRB text p.70, cite: 459-460]

Disarm an explosive set to go off. Requires a security kit or tool kit. The DC is usually 15 unless the individual who set the explosive chose a higher DC (see Set Detonator). If you fail the check by 5 or more, the explosive detonates. This takes a full-round action. [Sourced from CRB p.70-71]

dc.notes: DC can be higher if set by another character.

common_uses.description: Make temporary repairs to disabled mechanical/electronic device. Success gains +2 steps on condition track and 1d8 hit points (CR Errata p.290 [cite: 1969]). Device moves -5 steps and disables again at end of scene/encounter. Tool kit grants +5 bonus. [CRB text p.71, cite: 461-462]
Make a Mechanics check to modify a droid (see Modifying Droids, CRB p.197). Requires tool kit. [CRB text p.71, cite: 462]

dc.description: DC varies by modification, see CRB p.197.

common_uses.description: When acting as shield operator on vehicle or device with shield rating, spend three swift actions (same or consecutive turns) to make DC 20 Mechanics check. Success restores 5 SR points (up to max). [CRB text p.71, cite: 462-463]
When acting as engineer on vehicle or device, spend three swift actions to make DC 20 Mechanics check. Success moves vehicle +1 step on condition track. [CRB text p.71, cite: 463]

Repair a damaged or disabled droid. Restores HP equal to droid's character level and removes persistent conditions. Droid repairing self takes -5 penalty. Requires tool kit. [CRB text p.71, cite: 464-465]

Repair a damaged or disabled object (device/vehicle). Restores 1d8 HP and removes persistent conditions. If on board damaged vehicle, apply vehicle's condition track penalties to check. Requires tool kit. [CRB text p.71, cite: 465-466]

skills_list.description_general: You can bypass locks and traps, set and disarm explosives, fix malfunctioning devices, and modify and repair damaged droids. [CRB text p.70, cite: 455]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: You can usually retry a Mechanics check. In some specific cases (e.g., Disable Device, Set Detonator, Disarm Explosive), a failed check has negative ramifications that prevent or alter repeated checks. [CRB text p.71, cite: 466]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 or take 20 on a Mechanics check. [CRB text p.71, cite: 466]
When making a Mechanics check to accomplish a jury-rig repair, you can't take 20. [CRB text p.71, cite: 466-467]
CR Errata p.290[cite: 1970]: Characters who are untrained in the Mechanics skill can still use the aid another action to assist on Mechanics checks.

skills_list.name: Perception

common_uses.description: A Perception check made at the start of a battle determines whether or not you are surprised (see Surprise, CRB p.149). A Perception check made to avoid surprise is a reaction. [CRB text p.71, cite: 467]

dc.description: Compared against opponent's Stealth or circumstances.

common_uses.description: A DC 10 Perception check allows you to eavesdrop on a conversation. You must be able to understand the language being spoken. The DC increases to 15 in relatively noisy areas (such as a cantina) or 25 in particularly loud areas (such as a droid factory). Eavesdropping on a conversation is a standard action. [CRB text p.71, cite: 468]
A DC 10 Perception check allows you to detect and identify distant or ambient noises. Actively listening for distant or ambient noises is a standard action. [CRB text p.71, cite: 468-469]

A Perception check lets you hear or spot other targets or detect someone or something sneaking up on you from behind. If the target is actively attempting to remain undetected, your Perception check is opposed by the target's Stealth check. If the target is not making any special effort to avoid detection, the Perception check DC is determined by the target's size: Colossal, DC -15; Gargantuan, DC -10; Huge, DC -5; Large, DC 0; Medium, DC 5; Small, DC 10; Tiny, DC 15; Diminutive, DC 20; Fine, DC 25. For every 10 squares of distance between you and the target, you take a -5 penalty on your Perception check. You also take a -5 penalty if the target has concealment or cover, or a -10 penalty if it has total concealment or total cover. Detecting a target that enters your line of sight is a reaction. Actively looking or listening for hidden enemies is a standard action. [CRB text p.71, cite: 469-470]

Notice if a character has a concealed weapons or objects. Make a Perception check opposed by the target's Stealth check result. If you win the opposed check, you notice the concealed object. If you win by 5 or more, you can tell what kind of object is concealed. [CRB text p.71, cite: 471]
common_uses.action_cost: Reaction or Standard Action (part of noticing target)

common_uses.description: Carefully examine a 1-square area or a 1-cubic-meter volume as a full-round action. A DC 15 Perception check allows you to find clues, hidden compartments, secret doors, traps, irregularities, and other details not readily apparent within that area. The GM may increase the DC for especially obscure well-hidden features. [CRB text p.71, cite: 471-472]

dc.notes: GM may increase for very obscure/well-hidden features.

common_uses.description: Search a character for concealed weapons or objects. Make a Perception check opposed by the target's Stealth check result. If you win the opposed check, you find the concealed object. You receive a +10 circumstance bonus on your Perception check if you physically touch the target to search for concealed items; this requires a full-round action and can only be used on a willing, pinned, or helpless target. [CRB text p.71, cite: 472-473]
common_uses.time_to_perform: Varies (Perception check can be reaction, physical search is full-round action).

common_uses.description: You can use Perception to see through deceptive appearances made using the Deception skill. If your Perception check meets or exceeds the result of the Deception check, you realize that you're being deceived. Your Perception check to sense the deception is a reaction. [CRB text p.71, cite: 473]

Make a Perception check to determine whether someone is under the influence of a mind-affecting Force power or other method of coercion (assuming the effect isn't obvious). This requires a full-round action and a successful DC 20 check. [CRB text p.72, cite: 474-475]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to perceive threats as well as your surroundings. The distance between you and whatever you're trying to perceive affects your Perception check, as do solid barriers and concealment. [CRB text p.71, cite: 467]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: You can make a Perception check every time you have the opportunity to notice something as a reaction. As a swift action, you may attempt to see or hear something that you failed (or believe you failed) to notice previously. [CRB text p.72, cite: 475]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 or take 20 when making a Perception check. [CRB text p.72, cite: 475]
Taking 20 means you spend 2 minutes attempting to notice something that may or may not be there. [CRB text p.72, cite: 475]

skills_list.name: Persuasion

common_uses.description: As a full-round action, make a Persuasion check to adjust attitude of a creature (INT 2+). Target must see you. Modifiers: Hostile -10, Unfriendly -5, Indifferent -2, Friendly +0. Vs. target's Will Defense, success shifts attitude one step better. -5 penalty if target can't understand speech. Attempt once per encounter. [CRB text p.72, cite: 476-477]

Swift action: reduce Gather Info cost by half. Full-round action: increase/reduce item sell price by 50%. DC depends on target attitude (Unfriendly DC 30, Indifferent DC 25, Friendly DC 20, Helpful DC 15). No haggle with hostile/INT 2- or if standard price easily available elsewhere. [CRB text p.72, cite: 477-479]
common_uses.action_cost: Swift Action (Gather Info cost), Full-round Action (item price)

common_uses.description: Full-round action: force creature (INT 1+) to back down, surrender item, reveal info, or flee. Target must see you. Vs. target's Will Defense. Threat Modifiers: Target helpless +5 to You helpless -15. Can't force life-endangering actions. Success makes target more hostile later. [CRB text p.72, cite: 479-481]

threat_modifiers.situation: Target is helpless or completely at your mercy
Target is clearly outnumbered or disadvantaged
Target is evenly matched with you
You are clearly outnumbered or disadvantaged
You are helpless or completely at the target's mercy

skills_list.description_general: You can influence others with your tact, subtlety, and social grace, or you can threaten them into being more cooperative. [CRB text p.72, cite: 476]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: If you fail a Persuasion check (Change Attitude or Intimidate), you cannot make any further Persuasion checks against that creature for that purpose for 24 hours. [CRB text p.72, cite: 481]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on a Persuasion check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.72, cite: 481]

skills_list.name: Pilot

common_uses.description: Make a DC 15 Pilot check as a reaction to reduce or negate the damage from a collision (see Avoid Collision, CRB p.173). [CRB text p.73, cite: 482]
When operating a flying vehicle, make a Pilot check as a standard action to engage in a dogfight (see Dogfight, CRB p.171). [CRB text p.73, cite: 482-483]
When piloting a vehicle in combat, you can choose to make a Pilot check instead of an Initiative check to determine your place in the initiative order. [CRB text p.73, cite: 483]

Make a DC 20 Pilot check as a swift action to make your vehicle perform beyond its normal limits. If the check fails, your vehicle's speed does not increase, and your vehicle moves -1 step on the condition track. If you succeed, your vehicle's speed increases by 1 square until the start of your next turn. For every 5 points by which you exceed the DC, your vehicle's speed increases by an additional 1 square. You can't take 10 on this check. [CRB text p.73, cite: 483-484]
Make a Pilot check as part of a full-round action to collide intentionally with a target (see Ram, CRB p.172). [CRB text p.73, cite: 484]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to operate a vehicle. Basic operation does not require a skill check or special training, but performing evasive maneuvers and difficult stunts does. Whenever you make a Pilot check, you must apply the vehicle's size modifier to your check. [CRB text p.72, cite: 481-482]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Pilot check except when attempting to increase a vehicle's speed. [CRB text p.73, cite: 485]
You can't take 20 on a Pilot check. [CRB text p.73, cite: 485]

skills_list.name: Ride

common_uses.description: Typical riding actions (saddle, mount, ride, dismount) don't require checks. Mounting or dismounting is a move action. Checks required for tasks undertaken in combat or other extreme circumstances, trick riding, or convincing an animal to do something unusual. [CRB text p.73, cite: 485-486]
common_uses.action_cost: Varies (Mount/Dismount is Move Action; specific tasks have their own costs)

common_uses.description: As a move action, attempt to control a mount in combat. If fail, you can do nothing else that round. No roll needed for animals trained for battle. [CRB text p.73, cite: 486-487]
Mount or dismount as a swift action. If check fails, mounting/dismounting is a move action. (ACP Applies) [CRB text p.73, cite: 487]
React instantly to guide mount with knees to use both hands. Make check at start of round. If fail, one hand needed to control mount. [CRB text p.73, cite: 487-488]
Get mount to leap obstacles. Use Ride skill or mount's Jump skill (whichever lower) for distance. DC 15 Ride check to stay on mount when it leaps. [CRB text p.73, cite: 488-489]
React instantly when you fall off mount to try to avoid damage. Failure: 1d6 falling damage. [CRB text p.73, cite: 489] (Errata p.298 implies this could be a reaction similar to Use Mount as Cover)
React instantly to try to avoid falling when mount rears/bolts or when you take damage. [CRB text p.73, cite: 489-490]

As a reaction to an attack against you (Errata p.298 [cite: 2014]), drop down and hang alongside mount, using it as one-half cover. Can't attack while using mount as cover. If fail, no cover. [CRB text p.73, cite: 490]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to ride any kind of mount, such as a tauntaun, dewback, or bantha. [CRB text p.73, cite: 485]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Ride check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.73, cite: 490]
Errata p.298: Armor Check Penalty applies only when attempting to fast mount or fast dismount.

skills_list.name: Stealth

common_uses.description: Stealth check sets DC for Perception checks to notice you. Modifiers: Hampering circumstances -2, favorable +2. Moving > speed: -5 penalty. Moving > 2x speed: -10 penalty. Size modifiers apply (Fine +20 to Colossal -20). [CRB text p.73, cite: 491-492]

Standard action to conceal item (at least one size smaller). Modifiers based on object's relative size: One size smaller -5, two sizes smaller +0, three +5, four+ +10. Opposed by Perception. Drawing concealed item is a standard action (Errata p.290 [cite: 1970]). [CRB text p.73-74, cite: 492-494]
common_uses.action_cost: Standard Action to conceal, Standard Action to draw.

common_uses.description: Use Deception (vs. target's Will Defense) to get momentary diversion to make a Stealth check while target is aware. Must reach hiding place as move action. [CRB text p.74, cite: 494-495]

Standard action (Errata p.298 [cite: 2015]) to pilfer small, hand-sized object from target within reach. Stealth opposed by target's Perception (+5 bonus to target). Fail by 4 or less: no item, target unaware. Fail by 5+: no item, target catches you. [CRB text p.74, cite: 495-496]

Standard action (Errata p.298 [cite: 2015]) to palm hand-sized objects, perform minor legerdemain, or minor action unnoticed (flip switch, pull detonator, draw pistol under table). Opposed by observer's Perception. [CRB text p.74, cite: 496-497]

After ranged attack from hiding (at least 2 squares from target, target unaware), try to hide again. New Stealth check with -10 penalty as move action. Success: remain hidden. [CRB text p.74, cite: 497-498]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to slink past a sentry without being heard, catch your enemy off-guard, snipe from a concealed location, or perform sleight of hand. [CRB text p.73, cite: 490-491]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Stealth check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.74, cite: 498]

skills_list.name: Survival

common_uses.description: Once per day, make a DC 15 Survival check to avoid natural hazards and keep yourself safe and fed in the wild for the next 24 hours. You can provide food and water for one additional person for every 2 points by which your check result exceeds 10. [CRB text p.74, cite: 499]

Once per day, make a DC 20 Survival check to ignore the effects of extreme cold or extreme heat for the next 24 hours (see Extreme Temperatures, CRB p.254). Requires field kit. [CRB text p.74, cite: 499]
As a full-round action, ascertain which direction is north by succeeding on a DC 10 Survival check (assuming cardinal directions matter). [CRB text p.74, cite: 499-500]

Find or follow tracks. Requires a full-round action and a successful Survival check. DC depends on surface and circumstances (see table CRB p.75). Make new check when tracks become difficult. Move at half normal speed while tracking; normal speed incurs -5 penalty. [CRB text p.74-75, cite: 500-501]

circumstance_modifiers.condition: Every day since the trail was made
Every hour of rain since the trail was made
Fresh snow cover since the trail was made
Tracked target hides trail (and moves at half speed)

dc.notes: Reference CRB p.75 for full DC table and modifiers.

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to hunt and forage, guide a party safely through arid wastelands, identify signs that gundarks live nearby, or avoid quicksand and other natural hazards. [CRB text p.74, cite: 499]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Survival check. [CRB text p.75, cite: 503]
You can take 20 if there is no danger or penalty for failure, but it takes twenty times as long as normal to do so. [CRB text p.75, cite: 503]

skills_list.name: Swim

common_uses.description: A successful Swim check allows you to swim one-quarter your speed as a move action or one-half your speed as a full-round action. Roll once per round. If you fail, you make no progress through the water. If you fail by 5 or more, you go underwater and must hold your breath (see the Endurance skill, CRB p.66) until you reach the surface by succeeding on a Swim check. The DC depends on the situation. [CRB text p.75, cite: 504]

skills_list.description_general: Using this skill, a land-based creature can swim, dive, navigate underwater obstacles, and so on. [CRB text p.75, cite: 504]
skills_list.retry_rules_summary: A new check is allowed the round after a check is failed. [CRB text p.75, cite: 504]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Swim check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.75, cite: 504]

skills_list.name: Treat Injury

common_uses.description: As a full-round action, administer first aid to an unconscious or wounded creature. Requires a medpac. Success (DC 15): creature regains HP = character level +1 per point check exceeds DC. Medical kit grants +2 equipment bonus. Creature can only benefit once per 24 hrs. Self-aid: -5 penalty. [CRB text p.75, cite: 505-506]

Tend to a creature for 8 consecutive hours; creature regains HP = character level (in addition to natural healing). Benefit once per 24 hrs. Can tend 1 creature (untrained) or up to 6 (trained) simultaneously. Cannot give to self. [CRB text p.75, cite: 506-507]

dc.notes: Success is automatic if time commitment is met.

common_uses.description: Perform surgery to heal damage to a wounded creature. Requires a surgery kit. Takes 1 hour. Success (DC 20): heal HP = target's CON bonus (min 1) x target's level. Failure: target takes damage = its damage threshold. If target was at 0 HP, it dies (unless Force Point spent). Self-surgery: -5 penalty. Also removes persistent conditions. [CRB text p.75-76, cite: 508-510]

Install a cybernetic prosthesis. Requires Cybernetic Surgery feat and surgery kit. Takes 1 hour. Success (DC 20): prosthesis installed. Failure: not installed, can try again after another hour. Self-surgery: -5 penalty. [CRB text p.76, cite: 510-511]

As a full-round action, revive a creature that died within 1 round. Requires a medical kit. Success (DC 25): creature unconscious instead of dead. Failure: cannot revive. Medpac grants +2 equipment bonus. [CRB text p.76, cite: 511-512]

You can tend to a character afflicted by a disease. This takes 10 minutes of work. If your Treat Injury check against the DC of the disease is successful, the target character automatically recovers from the disease and no longer suffers its ill effects. You can make one attempt to treat a specific disease in a given character per day. Requires a medical kit or medpac. [Sourced from CRB p.74]

You can tend to a character afflicted by a poison. This takes 1 minute of work. If your Treat Injury check against the DC of the poison is successful, the target character no longer suffers any ill effects from the poison (though Hit Point damage already dealt by the poison is not restored). You can make one attempt to treat a specific poison in a given character per minute of treatment. Requires a medical kit or medpac. [Sourced from CRB p.74]

Treating an irradiated character requires 8 hours and a medical kit. Check vs. radiation's DC. Success: patient cured, persistent conditions from radiation removed. Can treat 1 (untrained) or up to 6 (trained) simultaneously. [CRB text p.76, cite: 513-514]

You can treat a character suffering from radiation poisoning. This takes 8 hours of work and requires a medical kit or medpac. If your Treat Injury check against the DC of the radiation (e.g., Moderate Radiation DC 20, Extreme Radiation DC 30, as per CRB p.255, Table 14-3) is successful, the patient is cured, and any persistent conditions from the radiation are removed. You can treat one untrained character or up to six trained characters simultaneously. You can use this application on yourself, but you take a -5 penalty on the check. [Sourced from CRB p.76, p.255]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to keep a badly wounded friend from dying, to heal the injured, or to treat a diseased or poisoned character. [CRB text p.75, cite: 505]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 when making a Treat Injury check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.76, cite: 514]

skills_list.name: Use Computer

common_uses.description: Connect to network (DC 10 Use Computer check if remote, full-round action) or use computer's local memory. Find info on topic (see table CRB p.77 for DC/time). Computer must be indifferent or better. Secret info requires helpful computer. [CRB text p.76-77, cite: 515-517, 519]

dc.notes: DC 10 to connect to network remotely.

common_uses.description: Plot a safe course through hyperspace. Usually requires 1 minute. DC varies by factors (see Astrogation, CRB p.237). [CRB text p.77, cite: 519-520]
Disable or erase a program on a computer that is helpful toward you. [CRB text p.77, cite: 520]

Full-round action to adjust computer's attitude. Check vs. computer's Will Defense. Modifiers: Hostile -10, Unfriendly -5, Indifferent -2, Friendly +0. Success: attitude shifts +1 step. Fail by 5+: attitude -1 step, admin notified. Hostile computer on fail by 5+ traces & isolates connection for 24hrs. (Computer attitudes table CRB p.77) [CRB text p.77, cite: 520-523]

Standard action to issue routine command (on/off, view/edit docs, print, open/close doors). Requires friendly or better computer. No check usually. Opposed Use Computer if contradictory command by another with same computer attitude. [CRB text p.77, cite: 523-525]
Reprogram droid (new master, copy data, change trained skills, erase memory). Requires tool kit. DC = droid's Will Defense. [CRB text p.77, cite: 525]

skills_list.description_general: Use this skill to access secured files and defeat security systems. [CRB text p.76, cite: 515]
special_rules_summary: You can take 10 on Use Computer checks. [CRB text p.78, cite: 526]
You can take 20 on a Use Computer check except when attempting to improve access. [CRB text p.78, cite: 526]
When a computer is friendly or helpful toward you, you gain an equipment bonus on all Use Computer checks made with that computer equal to its Intelligence bonus. [CRB text p.78, cite: 526]

skills_list.name: Use the Force

common_uses.description: Make a Use the Force check to use a Force power (see Force Powers, CRB p.95). This use of the skill requires no action. [CRB text p.78, cite: 527]
common_uses.action_cost: No action (part of Force power activation).

common_uses.description: As a full-round action, DC 10 Use the Force check to enter trance. Remain aware. Each hour, regain HP = character level. Emerge as swift action. 4 consecutive hours = full 8-hour rest. Go 10x longer without food/water. [CRB text p.78, cite: 527-528]

As move action, DC 10 Use the Force check to telekinetically lift/move object up to 5kg, 6 squares. As standard action, DC 15 to use object as projectile (1d6 bludgeoning if UtF check beats target's Reflex Defense). [CRB text p.78, cite: 528-530]
common_uses.action_cost: Move Action (to move), Standard Action (to use as projectile)

common_uses.description: Full-round action, DC 15 Use the Force check to determine if an action yields favorable/unfavorable results in immediate future (10 min or less). Does not account for long-term consequences. [CRB text p.78, cite: 530-531]

Automatically sense strong dark side disturbances (1 km), kin in mortal danger (10,000 light years), or major galactic disturbances. Full-round action, DC 15 Use the Force check to determine distance/direction of disturbance. Full-round action, DC 15 to actively sense other Force-users up to 100km (reveals number, approx. distance/direction, if met). Opposed by target's Use the Force to conceal. Errata (p.299): Can specify sensing only Dark Side users. [CRB text p.78, cite: 531-534]
Swift action, DC 15 Use the Force check to ignore effects of cover and concealment for Perception checks until start of next turn. DC +5 if vs. total cover. (Errata p.299). [CRB text p.78, cite: 534]

Standard action to establish telepathic link with distant creature (INT 2+). Exchange emotions or single thought. DC based on distance (see table CRB p.78). Vs. unwilling target, check vs. target's Will Defense (or base skill DC, whichever higher per Errata p.299); fail means no attempt for 24 hrs unless target becomes willing. [CRB text p.78, cite: 534-536]

skills_list.description_general: You draw upon the Force to help you recover from injuries, gain special insights, or perform other remarkable acts. Requires the Force Sensitivity feat to be trained in this skill. [CRB text p.78, cite: 526-527]
special_rules_summary: You can't make Use the Force checks unless you have the Force Sensitivity feat. [CRB text p.78, cite: 536]
Use the Force is a class skill for any character with the Force Sensitivity feat (CRB Table 4-2 footnote).
You can take 10 on a Use the Force check, but you can't take 20. [CRB text p.78, cite: 536]
